results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations) and Judith Dahlitz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.

results.title: Amazon: The Flooded Forest
results.brief_description: The Amazonian rainforest, flooded by up to ten metres of water every year, is one of the world’s last wetland frontiers. A magical submerged world and the greatest river system on earth, these huge flood plains are home to many remarkable creatures. The animals featured in this two part production include the primitive freshwater Boho dolphin, the Arowhana fish, dubbed by locals “the water monkey” because of its ability to leap two metres from the water to catch insects, and the strangest-looking monkey in the world, the Ukari. Narrated by Anthony Hopkins.

results.title: Amazon to ice
results.brief_description: Explore the wonderous waterways of South America from the infamous Tierra del Fuego to the raging rapids of the Upper Amazon; an area studded with relics from the ancient Inca past. A truly breathtaking journey includes the Moreno Glacier, the face of the Iguazu Falls and a visit to the inhabitants of the Islands in Lake Titicaca.

results.title: Amazing platypus [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Morris and John Shaw
results.brief_description: The playtpus is one of nature’s shy creatures. Only twice has a playtpus bred in captivity. Because they are found only in Australia, and will not breed in zoos, most people know very little about the playtpus. This exceptional film shows the playtpus on dry land, underwater and by means of a carefully sectioned burrow , we even follow him into his home.

results.title: Amazing platypus
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Morris, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The platypus is one of nature’s shy creatures. Only twice has a platypus bred in captivity. Because they are found only in Australia, and will not breed in zoos, most people know very little about the platypus. This exceptional film shows the platypus on dry land, underwater and, by means of carefully sectioned burrow, we even follow him into his home. This is a unique chance to see the mammal in its natural environment. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, John Morris, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Amazing H2o
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Waterworks”.
‘Episode 2: amazing H2O’ starts with the story of Henry Cavendish (Mark Allen), a rich scientist in the 17th century who made it his mission in life to discover the properties of water. His persistence gave us the H2O chemical name. With 70% of the earth covered in water, it is surprising to learn that scientists know more about the qualities of ice than water itself. Exploring both the realm of the known and unknown, this episode covers the following topics; surface tension, anti-gravitational behaviour, solutions, emulsions, ice, gas, evaporation, crystals. Presented by series producer Dick Beilby.

results.title: Amazing Grace
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Mary Hoffman and narrated by Alfre Woodard. Grace is a dramatic, creative girl who loves stories, whether she hears them, reads them or makes them up. Possessed of a wonderful imagination and a love of make believe, she constantly adopts roles and identities: Joan of Arc, Spider Man, Trojan Horse, Hiawatha, Mowgli, Aladdin, Dick Whittington etc. When her teacher asks who wants to play Peter Pan in the class production, Grace is very keen but dispirited when two classmates tell her she’s not eligible because she’s a girl and she’s black. Inspired by her mother, grandmother -“you can be anything you want if you put your mind to it”- and a Trinidadian dancer, she spiritedly auditions, wins the part and shines as Peter Pan. Caroline Binch’s radiant watercolour illustrations, the understated simplicity of the script, colloquial dialogue and endearing characters enhance the central positive message of self-affirmation. Suitable for children ages 4-8.

results.title: Amazing ants
results.brief_description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.
results.description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.

results.title: Amateur boxing: how to conduct a bout
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank Organisation, Frank Wells and Colin Bell
results.brief_description: This film is directed to teachers and instructors rather than boy boxers. It shows a three-round bout between two boys considering the match from the viewpoint of the officials. Demonstrates the work of the referee, the timekeeper and in greater detail, methods used by the referee for controlling the bout, and the methods of the judges for assessing the merits of the boxers. Shows, also, the value of a boxer’s seconds. Demonstrates how boxing can encourage sportsmanship.

results.title: Amateur
results.creator_credit: UGC Images, Zenith Entertainment, True Fiction Pictures, Ted Hope and Hal Hartley
results.brief_description: A quirky and absurdist comic thriller from writer/director, Hal Hartley. Isabelle (Isabelle Huppert) is an ex-nun awaiting an expected mission from God while making a living writing stories for pornographic magazines. She meets the kind and confused Thomas (Martin Donovan), who is suffering from amnesia and wandering the streets of New York in search of clues to his past, a past of viciousness and exploitation that only the appearance of his traumatized porn queen ex-wife, Sophia (Elina Lowensohn), begins to unravel. Intertwined with suspenseful thriller qualities and the subtlety of an unlikely romance, this film quietly spirals into a poignant tale of the pursuit of the reality of identity through memory and engagement with the past which leads sensitively to the inevitable tragedy of the final showdown.
